feed.title: Combined summary - Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants

entry.title: Combined summary - Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
entry.summary: The email exchange discusses various aspects of scalability and usability in Bitcoin, focusing on Lightning Network. It emphasizes the importance of catering to casual users and proposes multiple channels for them. Scalability is praised in terms of Lightning's ability to handle payments per channel without on-chain transactions. Hierarchical channels and timeout-trees are suggested for off-chain resizing and changing pairings.Creating Lightning channels for casual users is challenging due to coordination problems and the need for signatures. Simple covenants are proposed as a solution, allowing millions of casual users to co-own off-chain channels without complex coordination. Timeout-trees enable long-term scaling by rolling over balances without putting channels on-chain.Draining funds from old timeout-trees to new ones is addressed through the FFO-WF protocol and handling HTLCs. Accessing funds on-chain with a delay is also discussed, and timeout-trees provide immediate access to off-chain bitcoin.Enabling simple covenants and implementing timeout-trees can greatly improve Lightning's scalability and usability. The protocols mentioned allow for off-chain bitcoin transactions and address usability concerns. However, there are limitations such as the cost of resolving HTLCs on-chain and reliable relay of transaction packages.The email expresses hope for mechanisms like CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) or AnyPrevOut (APO) to be added to Bitcoin's consensus rules for wider adoption of Lightning as a means of payment.
